text: Home About Jim Issues Environmental Laws Menu Home About Jim Issues Environmental Laws Envelope Envelope Facebook Facebook Donate Donate Donate Donate His Experience is the Difference Primary Election for City Council On Tuesday, November 4 th , 2025 More than ever, our community needs experienced elected officials who can deliver for our families. Democrat Jim Gennaro will get our Queens neighborhoods the resources we deserve, protecting our school funding and the critical resources our first responders need to do their jobs. How do we know Jim can deliver? Because he has done it before... Jim Gennaro On Tuesday, November 4 th , 2025, let’s keep Jim Gennaro fighting for our community in the City Council. Jim Gennaro Jim Gennaro Will Deliver. He Already Has. Keeping Our Community Safe Keeping Our Community Safe Strengthened gun control laws and secured the funds and resources law enforcement professionals need to protect our families Enhancing Our Quality of Life Enhancing Our Quality of Life Rezoned neighborhoods to prevent over development and passed laws to protect communities from unscrupulous developers Improving Schools Improving Schools Secured over $68 million in funding for local schools and $38 million for youth programs Protecting Our Environment Protecting Our Environment Wrote the nationally-acclaimed NYC Climate Protection Act to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and 50 other major environmental laws that have created thousands of green jobs Click Here to Learn more About Jim Gennaro Click Here to Learn more About Jim Gennaro Click Here to see the full list on the Issues Click Here to see the full list on the Issues *protected email* Privacy Policy Privacy Policy Donate Donate Donate Donate Paid for by Gennaro 2025

Gennaro Rego Park, Forest Hills, Kew Gardens Hills, Pomonok-Electchester-Hillcrest, Fresh Meadows-Utopia, Jamaica Estates-Holliswood, Jamaica Hills-Briarwood, Mount Hebron & Cedar Grove Cemeteries, Jamaica, Flushing Meadows-Corona Park Staff Directory For constituent services, please email our office at district24@council.nyc.gov , or call us at (718) 217-4969. Chief of Staff & Budget Director – Henry Yam Email Address: Hyam@council.nyc.gov Deputy Chief of Staff & Communications Director – Natalia Trapani Email Address: Nkozikowska@council.nyc.gov District Manager & Community Liaison – Erick Adam Suionov Email Address: Esuionov@council.nyc.gov Scheduler – Jose Valera Email Address: JValera@council.nyc.gov Legislative Director – Josh Gachette Email Address: Jgachette@council.nyc.gov Community Liaison – Peter Paolo Email Address: Ppaolo@council.nyc.gov Staff Directory For constituent services, please email our office at district24@council.nyc.gov , or call us at (718) 217-4969. district24@council.nyc.gov Chief of Staff & Budget Director – Henry Yam Email Address: Hyam@council.nyc.gov Deputy Chief of Staff & Communications Director – Natalia Trapani Email Address: Nkozikowska@council.nyc.gov District Manager & Community Liaison – Erick Adam Suionov Email Address: Esuionov@council.nyc.gov Scheduler – Jose Valera Email Address: JValera@council.nyc.gov Legislative Director – Josh Gachette Email Address: Jgachette@council.nyc.gov Community Liaison – Peter Paolo Email Address: Ppaolo@council.nyc.gov Biography News Staff Directory District Office 83-15 Parsons Boulevard Jamaica, NY 11432 718-217-4969 phone Legislative Office 250 Broadway Suite 1773 New York, NY 10007 212-788-6956 phone Visit the Council We're located at New York City Hall. Council Members each have an office at 250 Broadway , as well as offices in each of their districts. We want to hear from you You can reach us via social media, email, paper mail, or at your district office. For issues specific to a neighborhood, it's best to contact the Council Member representing that community. Have questions, comments or feedback? Email us here.
